Paradoxine Information: Finding it
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Paradoxine Information: Finding it
By VashTheStampede on Monday, July 5, 2010 - 12:13 pm:

Paradoxine, a wonderful drug for long-lived Monsters. Most people know it's effects:

-18 Weeks of lifespan
+30 Skill upon successful (drill/errantry) stat-gains for 4 weeks
+30 Power upon successful (drill/errantry) stat-gains for 4 weeks

But, for me, the problem lies in actually GETTING it. I only ended up getting some ONCE, maybe twice, which was fairly early in the game. Maybe in the first 4-5 years or so... I got a total of 5 Vials of Paraoxine. However, even though I went to the Torles Expedition nearly every year (even soft-resetting to go again, if I didn't get any the first time), I never got one again.

I'm at roughly Year 1046 now, 40 years since the last time I got a Vial of Paradoxine. Is there some method, or perhaps an event that triggers their appearance, that I do not know about? NOBODY is this unlucky.

By Elf* on Monday, July 5, 2010 - 12:29 pm:

I am. 3 seperate monsters with 850 intelligence and in 20 tries I found it a grand total of zero times.
Just max out the intelligence of a selected monster and hope. After 10 years I finally managed to get 8
and now I have a wracky with maxxed out skill/power aged 9 months. You basically *need* 950
intelligence
though.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, July 5, 2010 - 07:57 pm:

Some items are linked to the monster's rank. Try getting to B or better. I am not certain that this will solve your problem, but, we have seen it affect a few other items.

By VashTheStampede on Tuesday, July 6, 2010 - 10:29 am:

I'm always at B Rank when I go for expeditions, since I end up doing a lot of fighting with 1st Gen monsters (Combining to get more starting moves), which I've only raised Gen 1 stuff so far, except for a Gen 2 Mocchi (Sparticus, and he lived up to that name easily, with 850+ in all stats, 8-9 years of life before freezing!).... but I digress.

I DID manage to get a few more on one trip recently. It was a Gen 2 Jill, my first Jill ever. =D It ended up snagging 2 Paradoxines on it's first trip to Papas. I think there may be a connection with the Papas and Kawarea expeditions of some sort.

In the Kawarea expedition, when you find a God's Slate, Dr. Talico makes some remarks about it, and the same thing happens in Papas with Rovest when you grab the Paradoxine. I never bothered doing the Kawarea trip a second time, since I grabbed my Mask and Fire Feather the first time.. But I decided to go again, and got junk to sell + 2x Gods Slates. When I had gone to Parepare and got more Gold Peached, Karvo did his little story as well... I finally went back to Papas, I went right to the Cave and found my 2 Paradoxines. :D

I'm going to try again, but it won't be for a while since I am messin around with a Serenity (Pixie/Plant). I wonder if anybody wants to take a look into this "Expedition Chain" as well?

By VashTheStampede on Tuesday, July 6, 2010 - 10:30 am:

Also, that Jill's INT was somewhere in the 600's, I believe. I'm not sure now. =(

By Elf* on Tuesday, July 6, 2010 - 12:46 pm:

To be honest I think that it's more luck with expeditions than a 'chain' of sorts. As you say, you can
go years without finding them but I managed to get two paradoxines in one expedition twice off the bat
after a lot of years of around ten/fifteen attempts each of finding nothing. Having said that, both of
those times it was with a Jill, whhich obviously is initially unlocked on the same expedition. Again,
probably chance, but it does make me wonder, seeing as I have Lummox (Jill with maxxed intelligence)
and Lemming (Oscerot with maxxed intellience), and Lemming never found anything. They're matched up for
a great combo though, so after training the curent wracky family I'm doing I'll get a Bengal and
experiment once more :B

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, July 7, 2010 - 09:56 am:

Honestly, I think what we are probably seeing is just the effects of something with a low probability of occurring. Even if an event has a 50/50 probability, such as a coin toss, it's possible to see 100 consecutive incidents with just one of the results, like 100 tails in a row.

To get any sort of handle on this, you'd need to start with a thousand or more resets in the same week to the same expedition to possibly see any sort of real pattern.

By big jay on Wednesday, July 7, 2010 - 10:50 am:

I agree, bad luck is prolly the biggest factor here. I've gone on 5 expeditions and have found it 5 times. Twice on the first trip and nothing on the last trip. oh fyi... i used a Blue Terror with 800ish INT, he was B-rank i believe.
